definition: a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]

sentences.english: She shouldn't have taken away my measuring tape, for I wanted to use it then.
sentences.chinese: 她本來不該帶走我的皮尺，因爲我那時要用。

sentences.english: "Next time you're in the shower, take a tape measure. "A couple of football players snickered.
sentences.chinese: 下次你們洗澡的時候，帶上一根皮尺。

sentences.english: Any obvious leg length discrepancy may be seen and can be checked for using a tape measure.
sentences.chinese: 可查看和使用皮尺測量任何明顯的腿長度差異。

sentences.english: Which of the following is the most suitable replacement for the measuring tape?
sentences.chinese: 下列哪項最適合用來代替皮尺？

sentences.english: The tape measure will show change well before the scale does.
sentences.chinese: 該皮尺將顯示改變之前，沒有規模。

sentences.english: All you need is a tape measure.
sentences.chinese: 你所需要的僅僅是一個皮尺。

definition: set square (tool to measure right angles)
to measure roughly (with the hand, a stick, string etc)
